definitions.definition: (of clothing) made of tweed, or having a similar rough texture
(of a person) wearing tweed clothing
(of a person) preppy
In a coarse manner
To clothe and ornament; to adorn or attire.
definitions.example: He was arrayed in his finest robes and jewels.

definitions.definition: To lay out in an orderly arrangement; to deploy or marshal.
To set in order, as a jury, for the trial of a cause; that is, to call them one at a time.
A vegetable in the onion family.
To resist or endure (something) successfully.
To oppose (something) forcefully.
The panels with which a surface (especially an indoor wall) is covered, considered collectively.
To make damp or moist; to make slightly wet.
To become damp or moist.
To depress; to check; to make dull; to lessen.
To become damped or deadened.
The act of making or becoming damp.
An athletic supporter worn by men to support the genitals during strenuous exercise.
To make thicker (in the sense of wider).
To make thicker (in the sense of more viscous).
definitions.example: to thicken a sauce

definitions.definition: To become thicker (in the sense of wider).
To become thicker (in the sense of more viscous).
To strengthen; to confirm.
To make more frequent.
definitions.example: to thicken blows

definitions.definition: To make a hissing sound.
definitions.example: As I started to poke it, the snake hissed at me.

definitions.definition: To condemn or express contempt (for someone or something) by hissing.
definitions.example: The crowd booed and hissed her off the stage.

definitions.definition: To utter (something) with a hissing sound.
To move with a hissing sound.
definitions.example: The arrow hissed through the air.

definitions.definition: To emit or eject (something) with a hissing sound.
To whisper, especially angrily or urgently.
The sound of a hiss.
Device used to measure the weight and height of a child
A device, often electronic, that measures the number of steps taken, and thus estimates the distance walked.
definitions.example: He thought that buying a pedometer would spur him on to exercise.

definitions.definition: To rumple; to press into wrinkles by crushing together.
To cause to collapse.
To become wrinkled.
To collapse.
Squeezed into a compact mass by irregular folds.
definitions.example: The crumpled paper was used as packing material.

definitions.definition: A shrub native to the southwestern United States and to Mexico, Simmondsia chinensis: the only plant known to store liquid wax in its seed.
Azote, nitrogen
Applied loosely to compounds having nitrogen variously combined, as in cyanides, nitrates, etc.
Now especially applied to compounds containing a two atom nitrogen group (-N=N-) uniting two hydrocarbon radicals, as in azobenzene etc.
A cunning or mischievous trick; a prank, a joke.
A buttock, or the buttocks; a person's bottom.
A fool.
The female genitals.
Cunning, astute.
A piece of land that stands out (usually into water) from the land surrounding.
A coming out of bedrock or of an unconsolidated deposit to the surface of the ground.
The part of a rock formation that appears at the surface of the ground.
(of a stratum) To come out to the surface of the ground.
(in the plural) Happenings; events; goings-on.
That which happens; an occurrence or happening, especially an unexpected, random, chance, or fortuitous event; chance; fortune; luck.
(Western Pennsylvania) A wrap, such as a quilt or a comforter. Also, a small or folded blanket placed on the end of a bed to keep feet warm.
Any of the cichlid fishes of the tribe Haplochromini.
To happen; to befall; to chance.
To happen to.
To wrap, clothe.
To make something less bright.
definitions.example: He dimmed the lights and put on soft music.

definitions.definition: To become darker.
definitions.example: The lights dimmed briefly when the air conditioning was turned on.

definitions.definition: To render dim, obscure, or dark; to make less bright or distinct
To deprive of distinct vision; to hinder from seeing clearly, either by dazzling or clouding the eyes; to darken the senses or understanding of.
At or nearest to the top; uppermost; being the very highest.
To thrust oneself in; to come or enter without invitation, permission, or welcome; to encroach; to trespass.
definitions.example: to intrude on families at unseasonable hours; to intrude on the lands of another

definitions.definition: To force in.
To aggregate things together into a batch.
definitions.example: The contractor batched the purchase orders for the entire month into one statement.

definitions.definition: To handle a set of input data or requests as a batch process.
definitions.example: The purchase requests for the day were stored in a queue and batched for printing the next morning.

definitions.definition: To live as a bachelor temporarily, of a married man or someone virtually married.
definitions.example: I am batching next week when my wife visits her sister.

definitions.definition: Prayer beads, a string of beads used to keep track of repetitions in prayer, particularly in the Roman Catholic Marian prayer "Hail Mary" (Ave Maria)

A Roman Catholic devotion involving the repetition of a series of Marian prayers, usually 5, 15, or 20 decades of "Hail Marys", each decade beginning with "Our Father" and ending with "Glory Be to the Father", but sometimes including other Roman Catholic, Anglican, or Lutheran prayers.
(by extension) A series or collection of thoughts, literary pieces, etc. intended for similar contemplation.
A 13th-century coin minted in Europe as a counterfeit debased form of the sterling silver penny of Edward I, at first accepted as a halfpenny and then outlawed.
A rose garden.
A substance that has effects similar to opium.
Any of the natural substances, such as an endorphin, released in the body in response to pain.
Any of a group of synthetic compounds that exhibit similarities to the opium alkaloids that occur in nature.
A command, bidding; sometimes also, an authoritative request; now usually in the phrase at the behest of.
A vow; a promise.
To promise; vow.
To grasp and remove quickly.
definitions.example: He snatched up the phone.

definitions.definition: To attempt to seize something suddenly.
definitions.example: to snatch at a rope

definitions.definition: To take or seize hastily, abruptly, or without permission or ceremony.
definitions.example: to snatch a kiss

definitions.definition: To steal.
definitions.example: Someone has just snatched my purse!

definitions.definition: (by extension) To take (a victory) at the last moment.
To do something quickly in the limited time available.
definitions.example: He snatched a glimpse of her while her mother had her back turned.

definitions.definition: The act by which something is snatched.
definitions.example: Three purse snatchings in the park were reported this week.

definitions.definition: A sheet of material (originally silk but now synthetic) with areas that are porous to ink and others that are non-porous to allow printing of images, such as on T-shirts.
To use a silkscreen to apply an image.
A person who has remarried.
To marry a second or subsequent time.
An amusingly eccentric or irrational person.
Amusingly eccentric or irrational.
Hurrah!
A restaurant.
A restoration (of an old car or building, etc.).
A charming person; one who charms or seduces; a smoothie.
An enchanter or magician.
A daring or adventurous act; an undertaking which goes against convention.
A small four-stringed guitar.
The training partner against whom tori performs a move.
(Japanese fiction) A passive or submissive male fictional character in a same-sex relationship; a bottom.
To touch or grasp with the lips; to kiss; to lap the lips against (something).
(of something inanimate) To touch lightly.
To wash against a surface, lap.
To rise or flow up to or over the edge of something.
To form the rim, edge or margin of something.
To utter verbally.
To simulate speech by moving the lips without making any sound; to mouth.
To make a golf ball hit the lip of the cup, without dropping in.
To change the sound of (a musical note played on a wind instrument) by moving or tensing the lips.
Having a raised lip.
(in combination) Having some specific type of lip.
definitions.example: We met a yellow-lipped woman.

definitions.definition: Random; chaotic; incomplete; not thorough, constant, or consistent.
definitions.example: Do not make such haphazard changes to the settings; instead, adjust the knobs carefully, a bit at a time.

definitions.definition: To contradict, to provide proof that something is not.
definitions.example: The thought is that you see an episode of observation, experiment, or reasoning as confirming or infirming a hypothesis depending on whether your probability for it increases or decreases during the episode.

definitions.definition: Weak or ill, not in good health.
definitions.example: He was infirm of body but still keen of mind, and though it looked like he couldn't walk across the room, he crushed me in debate.

definitions.definition: Irresolute; weak of mind or will.
Frail; unstable; insecure.
A bishop of the early Church; now specifically, the Pope.
Any chief figure or leader of a religion.
A pontifex.
The integument of animal; the skin.
The tissue of the skin underlying the epidermis.
A person who is skilled in, professes or practices dermatology.
(usually in the plural) guts
definitions.example: I saw an accident and a girl was lying on the pavement and her derms were all hanging out.

definitions.definition: A variable that is possibly predictive of the outcome under study.
To drive (someone or something) into a corner or other confined space.
definitions.example: The cat had cornered a cricket between the sofa and the television stand.

definitions.definition: To trap in a position of great difficulty or hopeless embarrassment.
definitions.example: The reporter cornered the politician by pointing out the hypocrisy of his position on mandatory sentencing, in light of the politician's own actions in court.

definitions.definition: To put (someone) in an awkward situation.
To get sufficient command of (a stock, commodity, etc.), so as to be able to manipulate its price.
definitions.example: It's extremely hard to corner the petroleum market because there are so many players.

definitions.definition: To turn a corner or drive around a curve.
definitions.example: As the stock car driver cornered the last turn, he lost control and spun out.

definitions.definition: To handle while moving around a corner in a road or otherwise turning.
definitions.example: That BMW corners well, but the suspension is too stiff.

definitions.definition: To supply with corners.
A piece of decorative work forming a corner.
The act by which somebody is cornered.

A southern-African subspecies of zebra, Equus quagga quagga, which went extinct in 1883. The upper parts of the animal were reddish brown, becoming paler behind and beneath, while the face, neck, and fore part of the body were marked by dark stripes.
A household; a domestic situation.
A type of cooperative society whereby all members pay a regular sum of savings, or through which goods can be paid for in installments.
A group of people living together in a sexual relationship.
To give a sermon.
definitions.example: A learned local Muslim used to preach in the small mosque every Friday.

definitions.definition: To proclaim by public discourse; to utter in a sermon or a formal religious harangue.
To advise or recommend earnestly.
To teach or instruct by preaching; to inform by preaching.
To give advice in an offensive or obtrusive manner.
The country of one's ancestors.
The country of one's birth.
Country of origin.
Mother country in contrast to its colonies.
To utter a deep guttural sound, as an angry animal; to give forth an angry, grumbling sound.
definitions.example: The dog growled at me as I walked past.

definitions.definition: Of a wind instrument: to produce a low-pitched rumbling sound.
To send a user a message via the Growl software library.
To express (something) by growling.
definitions.example: The old man growled his displeasure at the postman.

definitions.definition: To play a wind instrument in a way that produces a low-pitched rumbling sound.
A sustained instance of growls or guttural noises.
definitions.example: The growling from her stomach told us she was hungry.

definitions.definition: The technique of producing a low-pitched growling or rumbling sound on a wind instrument.
Producing a growl.
definitions.example: The growling dog frightened him.

definitions.definition: Impossible, or very difficult to describe.
definitions.example: He proved it with indescribable mathematics.

definitions.definition: Exceeding all description.
definitions.example: Our hotel had an indescribable view of the Bay of Naples.

definitions.definition: The formal charging of a defendant with an offense.
To draw a cartoon, a humorous drawing.
To make a preliminary sketch.
The act of drawing a cartoon or caricature.
The quality of being material; having a physical existence.
The quality of being of consequence to a legal decision.
Not graded; having no grade.

An infestation of parasitic mites, Sarcoptes scabiei, causing intense itching caused by the mites burrowing into the skin of humans and other animals. It is easily transmissible from human to human; secondary skin infection may occur.
A highly elevated tightrope.
To have a nap; to sleep for a short period of time, especially during the day.
To be off one's guard.
definitions.example: The regulators were caught napping by the financial collapse.

definitions.definition: To form or raise a soft or fuzzy surface on (fabric or leather).
To grab; to nab.
To cover (something) with a sauce (usually in passive).
The act of taking a nap or short sleep.
The act or process of raising a nap, as on cloth.
Not homogeneous
A publication that is published once a week.
Of a body in motion: the tendency of a body to maintain its inertial motion; the product of its mass and velocity.
The impetus, either of a body in motion, or of an idea or course of events; a moment.
To push, throw over, overturn or overthrow something
definitions.example: The massed crowds toppled the statue of the former dictator.

definitions.definition: To totter and fall, or to lean as if about to do so
definitions.example: The pile of pennies began to topple.

definitions.definition: The act by which something is toppled.
The range of days of the week that are normally worked
definitions.example: A 32-hour workweek is a 4-day week and an 8-hour day combined.

definitions.definition: A bud-like swelling, especially one at the end of an axon
In a manner that demonstrates excellence; very well.
A pilot partner of another, a pilot who flies in the same wing or squadron.
(by extension) a friend who accompanies one to offer (or receive) support, especially in flirting with love interests
A vessel of wood, tin, plastic, etc., usually cylindrical and having a handle -- used especially for carrying liquids, for example water or milk; a bucket (sometimes with a cover).
definitions.example: The milkmaid carried a pail of milk in each hand.

definitions.definition: (In technical use) A closed (covered) cylindrical shipping container.
(usually of a man) Large, well-built, and muscular.
definitions.example: He’s a big, burly rugby player who works as a landscape gardener.

definitions.definition: (East End of London) Great, amazing, unbelievable.
definitions.example: Kimi Räikkönen is a burly Formula 1 driver.

definitions.definition: (surf culture and/or Southern California) Of large magnitude, either good or bad, and sometimes both.
definitions.example: That wave was burly! (i.e. large, dangerous and difficult to ride)

definitions.definition: Full of burls or knots; knotty.
A windstorm with strong straight-line winds.
The side of a hill.
